content.description: Starts next to a boulder. Make a couple of easy clips then gain a crumbly undersidepull. Find the shockingly perfect bucket then finish on a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Facing into the Simpson's Hall corridor, the climb is on the arete in the back on the left.

content.description: Stout moves over a low bulge.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2-bolt anchor set well back and shared with Bart.
content.location: Westernmost face with bolted routes in Simpsons Hall area. East facing. This is the route on the left.

climbs.name: Homer
climbs.fa: EB Ryan Fields Mike Covington and John Bartlett 1990; FA Ryan Fields 1990

content.protection: 3 bolts to 2-bolt anchor usually decorated with tat.
content.location: One of the trio of westernmost routes in Simpsons Hall. North-facing overhanging climb immediately east of a small wall with two bolted routes (Sideshow Bob and Bart).

climbs.name: Bart
climbs.fa: Mike Covington, Ryan Fields & John Bartlett 1990

content.description: Stout moves on small holds getting to and past a low bulge.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2-bolt anchor set well back and shared with Sideshow Bob.
content.location: Westernmost face with bolted routes in Simpsons Hall area.   East facing. This is the route on the right.

content.description:
Another collection of crimpy pocketed climbs. Some of the scuds create a corridor which you might be able to find some shade/shelter in. Several of these climbs are harder and overhanging. 

  This area contains climbs 97-104 on the Marty Karabin fold out guide.
